intro: Rheedia humblotii, commonly known as the Humboldt's rheedia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its restricted habitat, Rheedia humblotii is considered a rare and endangered species.
